Name: T-Rex
Description: While the most powerful of all Attack-class vivosaurs, T-Rex cannot be placed in the SZ without severely hindering allies' abilities.
Fossil Museum: Powerful jaws and big teeth meant bone-shearing power.

Name: Daspleto
Description: The highest defensive rating of any Attack-class vivosaur and lots of LP make Daspleto well suited for drawn-out battles.
Fossil Museum: Mighty jaws suggest extremely powerful bite force.

Name: Gorgo
Description: Terrifyingly fast for something so big, Gorgo learns scare-type skills as it integrates more parts.
Fossil Museum: Long, strong legs provided impressive running speeds.

Name: Tarbo
Description: Initially slow to develop, Tarbo becomes extremely powerful after rank 9, gaining first-rate Attack.
Fossil Museum: Knifelike teeth and a big lower jaw made for a vicious bite.

Name: Alio
Description: Once it learns Poison Breath, Alio can guarantee a successful poison attack, good for inflicting massive damage.
Fossil Museum: The horn above the nose was apparently not used for battle.

Name: Siamo
Description: Once Siamo learns Sizzling Breath, it can prevent enemies from moving at all. It's also powerful at low ranks.
Fossil Museum: A relative of the allosaurus and sinraptor.

Name: Alectro
Description: Well-equipped with scare and poison skills, the versatile Alectro also features Auto Counter to punish attackers
Fossil Museum: A cone-shaped body type draws attention to the thick back legs.

Name: Guan
Description: A rare Transformation-class vivosaur, Guan also has excellent Attack support. Learn Great Unmasking to transform into a T-Rex!
Fossil Museum: Said to be an ancestor of the tyrannosaurus.

Name: Shanshan
Description: Shanshan lands a lot of critical hits, but a low LP ranking makes it vulnerable in the AZ position. Be careful!
Fossil Museum: A smaller dinosaur and cousin of the tyrannosaurus.

Name: Allo
Description: The strongest Neutral-type vivosaur, Allo is also valuable in the Support Zone for its good Evasion support.
Fossil Museum: The three claws were typical of Jurassic carnivorous dinosaurs.

Name: Metria
Description: When teamed with allies that boost Attack, Metria fights almost like an Attack-class vivosaur.
Fossil Museum: Distinguished by the large fin on its back.

Name: Megalo
Description: Relying on scare and excite skills to control the enemy, Megalo needs some time to develop its full potential.
Fossil Museum: Famous worldwide for being the first dinosaur to receive a name.

Name: Venator
Description: With Venator Fury in its arsenal, Venator can trap the enemy in the AZ. Team it with allies that have poison attacks.
Fossil Museum: Despite the sleek body, running speed was surprisingly slow.

Name: S-Raptor
Description: S-Raptor is a solid and versatile vivosaur even at low levels. It eventually learns Quicken for even more flexibility.
Fossil Museum: It is believed that the female was much bigger than the male.

Name: Giganto
Description: Since its support effects actually penalize its teammates, you'll need careful planning to get good use from the powerful Giganto.
Fossil Museum: Big head, big body...surprisingly tiny teeth.

Name: Cryo
Description: Proficient at harassing the enemy from the SZ with poison and excite skills, Cryo also has excellent support stats.
Fossil Museum: Characterized by bony bumps above the eyes.

Name: Carchar
Description: With enough parts integrated, Carchar can excite an enemy, then pound it with Carchar Fury for an effective combo.
Fossil Museum: Hollow bones made this heavy-looking dinosaur quite light.

Name: Acro
Description: Extremely well-balanced and valuable in either AZ or SZ positions, Acro is generally useful and dependable.
Fossil Museum: It formed a pack to attack larger dinosaurs.

Name: F-Raptor
Description: F-Raptor has good Attack for an All-Around class. Team it with other Japanese vivosaurs to use its unique powers.
Fossil Museum: Notable for big, curved claws and long front legs.

Name: Spinax
Description: Featuring an Auto Counter ability, Spinax deals damage when attacked and is effective anywhere on the field!
Fossil Museum: Had backbones that looked like long spikes.

Name: Neo
Description: Neo has weak Defense at low ranksâ€”integrate a few parts before bringing it to battle. Excite foes to prevent movement.
Fossil Museum: The narrow head was just one feature of this elegant dinosaur.

Name: Compso
Description: Compso's powerful support effects can render AZ-positioned enemies all but helpless.
Fossil Museum: Small, but with deadly sharp teeth and claws.

Name: Sopteryx
Description: From the SZ, Sopteryx can make an AZ ally nearly untouchable. FP Plus can help you use several high-FP skills in a row.
Fossil Museum: A strange dinosaur with birdlike feather growths.

Name: Delta
Description: Although it's most notable for its FP Plus ability, Delta's eventual confuse and counter skills make it a real threat.
Fossil Museum: Long, strong legs provided high land speed.

Name: Tro
Description: High support bonuses make Tro best suited for SZ positioning, but a high critical-hit rate helps its AZ chances.
Fossil Museum: A small, agile dinosaur, believed to have been highly intelligent.

Name: Nychus
Description: With low LP, Nychus is usually better off developing poison attacks to use from the SZ position.
Fossil Museum: Has a scary combo of sharp teeth and massive back claws.

Name: M-Raptor
Description: With impressive support bonuses and a set of poison skills, M-Raptor can be a valuable SZ addition to any team.
Fossil Museum: With its small, birdlike wings, this dinosaur was capable of flight.

Name: U-Raptor
Description: While the success rate is low at only 20%, U-Raptor has the ultimate poison skill. Care to try your luck?
Fossil Museum: Characterized by big claws on both front and back legs.

Name: V-Raptor
Description: While it relies mostly on poison skills, V-Raptor will eventually learn Enflame, making it far more versatile in battle.
Fossil Museum: The ferocious bite and sharp claws were a scary combo.

Name: Breme
Description: Its poison and thieving skills help make up for Breme's low LP. How useful it is to you depends on how good your strategy is.
Fossil Museum: When first discovered, this fossil was mistaken for an owl fossil.

Name: Aopteryx
Description: Although one of the weakest Vivosaurs, Aopteryx's ability to transform sets it apart. LP and FP-stealing skills help too.
Fossil Museum: Thought to be a bird ancestor, though not all agree.

Name: Coelo
Description: Coelo will eventually learn to use Neutralize, erasing all effects from the target. It also has excellent support effects.
Fossil Museum: Characterized by big eyes, swift feet, and possible herd behavior.

Name: Dilopho
Description: Dilopho's FP Plus ability is extremely valuable to build FP quickly, but be careful of its low Defense.
Fossil Museum: The frills gave this dinosaur a stylish edge.

Name: Spino
Description: Even though it eventually learns a powerful poison skill, Spino should be kept in the AZ to avoid negative support effects on allies.
Fossil Museum: Characterized by a large, fanlike fin on its back.

Name: Angato
Description: With its high Attack, you should try to keep Angato in the AZ. It eventually learns some useful poison skills as well.
Fossil Museum: With a snout like a crocodile's, this dinosaur ate meat and fish.

Name: Sucho
Description: By the time Sucho learns Poison Barrage, it will be capable of using combos of poison and excite for inescapable damage.
Fossil Museum: Lots of little fangs filled this creature's large mouth.

Name: Onyx
Description: Onyx's low Defense rating at low ranks means you should be sure to collect a few parts before sending it into battle. :(
Fossil Museum: The large front claws may have been used to catch fish.

Name: Cerato
Description: Cerato lands a lot of critical hits, and its knock skills are invaluable for breaking up enemy strategies.
Fossil Museum: Characterized by three horns on the head and a long tail.

Name: Carno
Description: Not highly compatible with other vivosaurs, Carno is a "lone wolf" that can take on even Fire types once it learns knock skills.
Fossil Museum: Recognized by small arms and the two horns above its eyes.

Name: Orno
Description: Featuring a support effect that doubles Accuracy (!), Orno is ideally teamed with an ally with a high critical rate.
Fossil Museum: Known for a birdlike head on a long neck and elongated fingers.

Name: Cheirus
Description: Since Cheirus's support effect drops enemy Evasion to nearly zero, it's a big help to allies with low Accuracy.
Fossil Museum: Known to have had extremely long arms and large nails.

Name: O-Raptor
Description: With the eventual ability to steal enemy FP, O-Raptor is especially useful to help you power expensive or team skills.
Fossil Museum: A long-armed dinosaur with a notable head crest.

Name: Zino
Description: When Zino lands a blow, it's a guaranteed critical, but its Accuracy is so low that it needs ally support effects to hit.
Fossil Museum: The long arms and nails may have been used for digging.

Name: Brachio
Description: Rearrange the field with Mighty Stomp and take advantage of Brachio's effective SZ attacks.
Fossil Museum: This bizarre dinosaur had nostrils on top of its head.

Name: Salto
Description: With Long-Range-class range and Auto Counter ability, Salto is effective from any area of the battlefield.
Fossil Museum: Featured thick skin along the spine, almost like armor.

Name: Shuno
Description: Shuno specializes in long-range attacks, blazing away from anywhere on the battlefield.
Fossil Museum: Characterized by four spikes on its long tail.

Name: Perso
Description: The ultimate Long-Range-class vivosaur, Perso can use Clear the Path for big boosts to FP.
Fossil Museum: Surrounded in mystery, this beast was at least 100 ft. long.

Name: Seismo
Description: Excellent LP and an Auto LP Recovery ability make Seismo a solid guard for the AZ.
Fossil Museum: An immense dinosaur that shook the earth when it walked.

Name: Apato
Description: Although a powerful attacker from the SZ, learning Sacrifice will tend to push Apato into a healing role.
Fossil Museum: In the past, this dinosaur was called brontosaurus.

Name: Amargo
Description: Once Amargo learns Power Scale, it allows for powerful strategies involving barrages of high-FP attacks.
Fossil Museum: The spiky neck makes for a unique, monster-like appearance.

Name: Stego
Description: Available only using Donation Points, Stego is a favorite of Dr. Diggins's and an LP powerhouse.
Fossil Museum: Uniquely shaped with backbone plates and a spiked tail.

Name: Yango
Description: With impressive support effects, Yango can contribute from the SZ, blasting away with its Fire Spines skill.
Fossil Museum: Featured more spikelike back plates than the stegosaurus.

Name: Jiango
Description: With Auto Counter and a high critical rate, Jiango is best suited for battling from the AZ position.
Fossil Museum: The most famous cousin of the stegosaurus in Asia.

Name: Kentro
Description: With development, Super Harden and the confuse skill Wind Spines make Kentro an excellent SZ vivosaur.
Fossil Museum: Extremely prickly, with numerous spikelike growths.

Name: Lexo
Description: Poison and sleep skills combined with Auto Counter ability make Lexo a versatile part of various strategies.
Fossil Museum: Characterized by narrow back plates and big shoulder spikes.

Name: Nodo
Description: Best of the best in Defense rating, the addition of Power Scale makes Nodo perfect for marathon battles.
Fossil Museum: Protected by thick, armorlike skin on its back.

Name: Ankylo
Description: From the SZ position, Ankylo can double (!) the AZ vivosaur's Defense, but this comes at the price of a cut to Attack.
Fossil Museum: The most famous (and largest) of the armored dinosaurs.

Name: Saichan
Description: With impressive defensive support and Auto Counter ability, Saichan is a valuable ally in battles of attrition.
Fossil Museum: Protected by spiked, armorlike bone on the back and flank.

Name: Goyle
Description: With significant support effects, any ally teamed up with Goyle stands to gain major benefits from their partnership.
Fossil Museum: Notable for the triangular head, beak, and spiked armor.

Name: Pelto
Description: Pelto not only features Auto Counter ability but is one of the few vivosaurs to learn sleep skills.
Fossil Museum: Identified by the large spikes on its neck and shoulders.

Name: Hypsi
Description: An important contributor with healing ability, Hypsi's support effects make it most valuable in an SZ role.
Fossil Museum: A small dinosaur with a small beak on a small head.

Name: Nasaur
Description: Nasaur can learn to use a low-FP team skill and features enemy-punishing support effects across all stats.
Fossil Museum: Believed to have been active at night, aided by big eyes.

Name: Igua
Description: Igua is a dependable All-Around-class vivosaur with a confuse skill to throw enemy strategies off balance.
Fossil Museum: Featured spikes on its front big toes and a healthy population.

Name: Ourano
Description: Learning both Ourano Combo and Counter Blow will set Ourano up for an amazing one-two punch.
Fossil Museum: A thick-bodied dinosaur sporting a large, humped back.

Name: Lambeo
Description: Unusual for an Attack-class vivosaur, Lambeo can learn a team skill that will heal its entire team. It also has excellent LP.
Fossil Museum: The head crest was seemingly connected to the nose.

Name: Maia
Description: With a large suite of healing skills and a solid support effect, Maia is useful in long, drawn-out battles.
Fossil Museum: Gentle dinosaurs that worked in groups to rear their young.

Name: Anato
Description: With its 100% confuse skill, Anato can be teamed with counter-capable allies for a powerful team.
Fossil Museum: With its duck face, this might have been the funniest dinosaur.

Name: Paraloph
Description: Strongest of all Counter Blow vivosaurs, Paraloph can make counter attacking a major part of your battle strategy.
Fossil Museum: A large head ornament may have been used for sound resonance.

Name: Pachy
Description: Pachy doesn't lose any power attacking from the SZ! Take advantage of its support effects and stick it out in the SZ.
Fossil Museum: The round head bone gives us the name "thick-headed lizard."

Name: Stygi
Description: Team up Stygi's low-FP skills with high-FP vivosaurs and take advantage of a well balanced arsenal of skills.
Fossil Museum: Featured numerous horns behind a bony head protrusion.

Name: Goyo
Description: Teamed up with Pachy and Stygi, Goyo's support effects can weaken the enemyâ€”perfect for team-skill attacks!
Fossil Museum: Name means "decorated head"...for obvious reasons.

Name: Proto
Description: Under normal circumstances, Proto is a reliable Support type, but Metamorphosis transforms it into a powerful Tricera!
Fossil Museum: Featured a bill like a parrot and the ability to walk on two legs.

Name: Tricera
Description: An offensive threat in either the AZ or SZ roles, Tricera also features the Parting Blow ability.
Fossil Museum: Among the best-known dinosaurs, with three trademark horns.

Name: Styraco
Description: Along with Parting Blow, Styraco is best used alongside a high critical hit rate ally in the AZ.
Fossil Museum: The collar spikes were a feature of males only.

Name: Einio
Description: Cutting the enemy's Evasion in half, Einio should be teamed with a critical-proficient AZ ally. Parting Blow adds even more value.
Fossil Museum: The most notable feature was a hooked horn above the nose.

Name: Centro
Description: Centro's high critical-hit rate is balanced by its terrible Accuracy. Support it well and be rewarded. Parting Blow helps its utility.
Fossil Museum: Most notable for the large nose horn and collar spikes.

Name: Penta
Description: With both excite and healing skills, Penta is a valuable ally to have in the SZ position.
Fossil Museum: A large dinosaur that looks to have five facial horns.

Name: Pachrino
Description: In addition to a vicious Parting Blow, Pachrino can also knock unsuspecting enemies into the EZ with its Pachrino Combo.
Fossil Museum: Featured a bone cluster above the nose rather than a horn.

Name: Mihu
Description: Mihu features both Parting Blow ability and a mighty team skill when teamed with F-Raptor and Futabi.
Fossil Museum: While much is unknown about it, it is likely a triceratops relative.

Name: Ptera
Description: Ptera's frequent critical hits are best used from the SZ, where its impressive support effect can come into play.
Fossil Museum: The head crown is thought to have been key to its flight.

Name: Coatlus
Description: With versatile skills and no Attack loss from the SZ, Coatlus can be used to attack just as furiously as its AZ ally.
Fossil Museum: The largest flying reptile, it also featured a bladelike beak.

Name: Jara
Description: A real tactician's vivosaur with FP-thieving and sleep skills, Jara can be a key tool in engineering come-from-behind victories.
Fossil Museum: A mysterious dinosaur known for its unique head ornamentation.

Name: Dimorph
Description: Although effective with its enrage skills, Dimorph is most notable for its powerful, enemy-hampering support effects.
Fossil Museum: Winged, with a big head and long tail, it also walked on two legs.

Name: Guera
Description: Guera's skills tend to interfere with enemy tactics, using swapping and sleep skills. It also packs good support effects.
Fossil Museum: Oddly shaped, with a long head and short rear legs.

Name: Krona
Description: Krona's great Attack isn't hampered from the SZ. Powerful enough to be considered the T-Rex of the seas.
Fossil Museum: Its biting power was stronger than even the tyrannosaurus.

Name: Futabi
Description: Futabi develops excite skills as its core arsenal and reaches its full potential when teamed with F-Raptor and Mihu.
Fossil Museum: This was the first long-necked dinosaur discovered in Japan.

Name: Elasmo
Description: Powerful even at low ranks, Elasmo exhibits equal power from the AZ or SZ, making it a versatile and dependable ally.
Fossil Museum: The elongated neck was as long as its body.

Name: Plesio
Description: Over time, Plesio builds up a powerful poison arsenal and proves devastating when teamed with excite-capable allies.
Fossil Museum: Possibly the best swimmer among all ancient reptiles.

Name: Shoni
Description: While powerful, Shoni is hampered by very slow development. Use in battle only after achieving sufficient rank.
Fossil Museum: This massive swimmer evolved in a way similar to fish.

Name: Arsith
Description: As one of the few vivosaurs to learn sleep skillsâ€”and boasting impressive support effectsâ€”Arsith is a trusty SZ ally.
Fossil Museum: Mammal similar to a rhinoceros, but with two large horns.

Name: Brontoth
Description: Despite its low LP, Brontoth shows its true potential when teamed with Arsith and Elasmoth. Parting Blow is also a plus.
Fossil Museum: This mammal featured a unique Y-shaped horn above the nose.

Name: Elasmoth
Description: The Parting Blow ability gives Elasmoth a power boost when it's faced with defeat. It ain't over 'til it's over!
Fossil Museum: Wooly mammal with a single horn extending up to 6 ft. long.

Name: Hoplo
Description: Place Hoplo in the SZ and take advantage of its FP Plus ability, powerful support effects, and great Evasion.
Fossil Museum: Almost like a little tiger with long, sharp fangs.

Name: Andrarch
Description: The Link ability allows Andrarch to link blows together with teammates' attacks. Its high critical rate is icing on the cake.
Fossil Museum: Possibly the largest land-dwelling carnivorous mammal.

Name: Paki
Description: Paki's Link ability is activated when it's the SZ, and attacks at no cost to the FP pool makes for economical battling.
Fossil Museum: Despite walking on four legs, this mammal was a relative to whales.

Name: Smilo
Description: With FP Plus and amazing support effects, Smilo is the only vivosaur that can add 90% to allies' Defense and Evasion.
Fossil Museum: Also called "saber-toothed tiger" because of its massive fangs.

Name: Mammoth
Description: Suited for marathon battles with Auto LP Recovery, Mammoth reaches its full potential once it learns Sacrifice.
Fossil Museum: This mammal was characterized by its curled tusks and woolly coat.

Name: Tryma
Description: The Link ability allows Tryma to sneak in irritating attacks on its allies' turns.
Fossil Museum: A flightless bird with a big beak and thick legs.

Name: Megath
Description: Although slow to develop, its high critical rank is excuse enough to use Megath at low ranks.
Fossil Museum: A big, lazy, land-dwelling, grass-eating slacker mammal.

Name: Chelon
Description: With no power lost when attacking from the SZ and counter-proof attacks, Chelon can comfortably fire away from the SZ.
Fossil Museum: What looks like a shell is actually thick, tough skin.

Name: Dinomaton
Description: A powerful robot featuring deadly attacks, Dinomaton's weakness is its low Defense.
Fossil Museum: A dinaurian-made robot, packed with cutting-edge tech!

Name: Duna
Description: With a 100% confuse skill and unrivaled support effects, Duna is obviously one of the dinaurian elite!
Fossil Museum: Duna, as expected, is just as pretty in her battle form!

Name: Raptin
Description: A 100% poison skill and off-the-charts support effects make one thing clearâ€”Raptin sure can put up a fight!
Fossil Museum: Raptin in battle form is a savage and deadly enemy.

Name: Dynal
Description: Excite AND poison skills with 100% success rates? Yes, Dynal is indeed the king!
Fossil Museum: Dynal in battle form exudes an aura of majesty and...POWER!

Name: Frigi
Description: One of the legendary dinosaurs, all of Frigi's skills rank among the best and will freeze any enemy solid!
Fossil Museum: It's unclear how such a powerful creature could ever have been fossilized. Maybe it wasn't?

Name: Igno
Description: Legendary dinosaur and rival of Frigisaurus, Igno leaves a trail of scorched victims wherever it goes!
Fossil Museum: Revived from a fossil buried so long in the heart of a volcano that it absorbed all the heat.

Name: Squik
Description: Born from a mysterious egg fossil, Squik features powerful support effects that lower all AZ enemy stats.
Fossil Museum: A mysterious Neutral-type vivosaur born from an egg. Soft and fluffy, but tough in battle!

Name: Squirk
Description: Born from a mysterious egg fossil, Squirk features fantastic support effects, including a 50% Attack boost!
Fossil Museum: A mysterious Fire-type vivosaur born from an egg. Hot under the collar, but tough in battle!

Name: Squirth
Description: Born from a mysterious egg fossil, Squirth features fantastic support effects, including a 50% Defense boost!
Fossil Museum: A mysterious Earth-type vivosaur born from an egg. Silky smooth, but tough in battle!

Name: Squilk
Description: Born from a mysterious egg fossil, Squilk features fantastic support effects, including a 50% Accuracy boost!
Fossil Museum: A mysterious Water-type vivosaur born from an egg. Wet behind the ears, but tough in battle!

Name: Squiro
Description: Born from a mysterious egg fossil, Squiro features fantastic support effects, including a 50% Evasion boost!
Fossil Museum: A mysterious Wind-type vivosaur born from an egg. A bit of a blowhard, but tough in battle!

Name: Guhweep
Description: One of the three brains of the world-eating monster, Guhnash, Guhweep wields Tears of Dark Light, which recovers team LP.
Fossil Museum: One of Guhnash's surprisingly dangerous brains, able to evade nearly any attack.

Name: Guhvorn
Description: One of the three brains of the world-eating monster, Guhnash, Guhvorn wields Cascading Savagery, strongest of ALL attack skills.
Fossil Museum: One of Guhnash's surprisingly dangerous brains, a vicious and savage attacker.

Name: Guhlith
Description: One of the three brains of the world-eating monster, Guhnash, Guhlith employs Billowing Anger for big damage and 100% excite rate.
Fossil Museum: One of Guhnash's surprisingly dangerous brains, with a shell as hard as diamonds.

Name: Aeros
Description: An Air-type vivosaur boasting high Attack and LP, Aeros's Parting Blow is triggered when it feels threatened.
Fossil Museum: A relative of the fukuiraptor, except twice its size.

Name: Mapo
Description: With high Attack even at low ranks, Mapo can be counted on at any time. It also has Auto Counter.
Fossil Museum: Said to be the tyrannosaurus of the southern hemisphere.

Name: Berto
Description: Berto is a Close-Range vivosaur with high Attack and Defense. It can also learn a skill that enrages the target.
Fossil Museum: A razor-fanged, smaller relative of the tyrannosaurus.

Name: Raja
Description: Raja is an Earth-type vivosaur adept at close-range attacks. Once it learns Charge, its already-tough attacks become devastating.
Fossil Museum: A horn-capped carnivore thought to be slow on its feet.

Name: Krypto
Description: Krypto can doom a target using the infectious Krypto Toxin, but its support effects increasingly hamper allies when it ranks up.
Fossil Museum: Characterized by its stubby snout and thick-skinned head.

Name: Archaeo
Description: When highly raised, Archaeo's support effects sharply boost Attack and Accuracy. It can also learn a skill that lifts health conditions and restores LP.
Fossil Museum: A relative of the triceratops, it walked on its hind legs.

Name: Epidex
Description: An expert in the use of poison skills, Epidex backs allies with generous support effects and the Link ability.
Fossil Museum: Known for its striking tail plume of four feathers.

Name: Lagia
Description: Lagia is a rare vivosaur possessing not only the Parting Blow ability, but Link as well.
Fossil Museum: Famous for its winglike vestigial forelegs.

Name: E-Raptor
Description: E-Raptor is a master of vexing skills including condition afflictions and FP thievery. Its support effects also cut enemy Attack and Defense stats.
Fossil Museum: One of the oldest dinosaurs ever discovered.

Name: Toba
Description: Its support effects add to the Attack and Defense of allies. Being a Long-Range attacker, it can subject a Fire-type target to deadly attacks from the SZ.
Fossil Museum: A burly, long-necked dinosaur discovered in Japan.

Name: Nigo
Description: Its stats are excellent, and it knows Link, but lazy Nigo always enters battle asleep.
Fossil Museum: Its odd mouth lined with tiny teeth calls to mind a harmonica.

Name: Camara
Description: Camara learns a rare skill that randomly boosts the status of an ally. It also knows Auto LP Recovery.
Fossil Museum: The boxy, short-snouted skull is distinctive for its large nostrils.

Name: Seidon
Description: An extra-large vivosaur that grows slowly but makes strong LP gains. Seidon's Auto Counter makes it a dangerous opponent.
Fossil Museum: Longer legged in the front, it was apparently quite slim.

Name: Menchi
Description: Menchi's attack doubles if it's the only battle-ready vivosaur in its team. Unleash a powerful move using bonus FP to turn the tables!
Fossil Museum: It used its extra-long neck to eat the leaves from trees.

Name: Argento
Description: When fully raised, Argento's LP and Attack rise to top levels. It can also absorb expended FP when under attack.
Fossil Museum: The largest dinosaur to ever walk the earth, topping 100 tons.

Name: Dacerus
Description: Dacerus is highly proficient in the use of poison-related moves. It also absorbes some FP when attacked.
Fossil Museum: Its name means "very sharp tail," and with good reason.

Name: Tsintao
Description: A versatile vivosaur with the Link ability, Tsintao can learn a skill that hits multiple times. Its support effects impact enemy stats across the board.
Fossil Museum: Distinguished by the vertical horn growing on its forehead.

Name: Pacro
Description: Pacro is a maternal vivosaur with a slate of healing skills. It even has a powerful team skill that heals the LP of all allies.
Fossil Museum: Thought to be a favorite prey animal of the tyrannosaurus.

Name: Oloro
Description: A vivosaur with a high critical rate, Oloro's effectiveness is further enhanced by its Link ability.
Fossil Museum: Easily recognized by its large, ax-like crown.

Name: Nippono
Description: Nippono can restrict enemy actions by rotating their zones and using Payback. The Link ability only adds to its effectiveness.
Fossil Museum: A fleet-footed relative of the hypacrosaurus.

Name: Chasmo
Description: An Air-type vivosaur that knows Parting Blow, Chasmo is a fierce battler when teamed with an ally that knows Law of the Jungle.
Fossil Museum: The large vents on its massive skull kept its head light.

Name: Berta
Description: Berta's sleep and confuse skills let it hamper enemy actions. If the enemy team is rendered inactive, this vivosaur can make its Parting Blow status last.
Fossil Museum: The many horns growing from its collar gave it a fearsome look.

Name: Nycto
Description: Nycto has a high critical hit rate and can learn an LP-stealing skill. It also has the FP Plus ability, which boosts the team's FP recharge volume.
Fossil Museum: A large-crowned, winged lizard that lived on seaside cliffs.

Name: Sungari
Description: Sungari backs up its team with enrage and rotation skills. It also knows Immolation for critical situations.
Fossil Museum: A rare winged lizard found in areas that were once lakes.

Name: Thalasso
Description: Place Thalasso in a support role to take advantage of its FP Plus ability. It also has a powerful team skill that damages and poisons all enemies.
Fossil Museum: A large-crowned, winged lizard that attacked with its jaws.

Name: Hopter
Description: Hopter has high LP for a pterodactyl. But with negative team-support effects and disobedience if its LP drops below 50%, it's a handful for any Fighter.
Fossil Museum: A winged lizard so huge and heavy, some say it couldn't fly.

Name: Machai
Description: With strong support effects and a condition-lifting skill, Machai makes a good addition to any team. The Link ability adds to its effectiveness.
Fossil Museum: It took on larger prey with its razor-sharp fangs.

Name: Peloro
Description: If Peloro is on its own, it activates Solo Power for outrageous Attack. If it's with a team, Super Enflame can pump them up instead!
Fossil Museum: A massive relative of the water buffalo, with horns 10 feet wide.

Name: Metri
Description: Metri can make shambles of enemy tatics with its rotation skill. It can also learn a skill that randomly afflicts a target with status ailments.
Fossil Museum: Thought to be a herbivore despite its impressive tusks.

Name: Gomp
Description: Gomp supports allies with its Super Harden skill, while Position Lock thwarts enemy attempts to rotate your team.
Fossil Museum: Both its upper and lower jaws bore tusks.

Name: Anan
Description: Anan's Position Lock ability holds it in place against zone rotations. Use Charge to prepare for a massive strike.
Fossil Museum: Its straight tusks grew to be longer than its entire body.

Name: Parium
Description: Due to Elemental Boost, Parium hits Water-type enemies especially hard, but beware of Earth-type attacks. It also has Link for an extra bit of oomph.
Fossil Museum: The largest land mammal, it was triple the weight of an elephant.

Name: Ceros
Description: Ceros is a healing vivosaur that can learn to restore LP and lift conditions. Keep it far away from Earth-type enemies!
Fossil Museum: One of the largest deer, it had the most massive antlers ever.

Name: Synthos
Description: Synthos usually plays a supporting role, as Link helps it augment allied attacks. When on its own, however, its Attack gains a massive bonus.
Fossil Museum: Possibly a camel relative, with horns on its head and snout.

Name: Titanis
Description: Once Titanis learns its team-rotation skill, throw the enemy into disarray by shuffling them around!
Fossil Museum: A flightless bird that used its claws, speed, and size to hunt.

Name: Dimetro
Description: Dimetro learns a team-attack skill as it grows. Use its Charge skill to ready a wicked attack on the next turn.
Fossil Museum: The large dorsal sail helped them tell each other apart.

Name: Edapho
Description: This Air-type vivosaur can learn Rallying Cry, a skill that lifts all conditions afflicting an ally. Edapho can also absorb a portion of FP when attacked.
Fossil Museum: The large sail was used to control its body temperature.

Name: Tanstro
Description: Naturally sleepy, Tanstro enters battle while still in dreamland. It can, however, learn a skill that strikes the entire enemy team.
Fossil Museum: Its long, stiff neck made it a poor swimmer.

Name: Pendem
Description: Pendem can learn confuse skills that affect the entire enemy team, while Position Lock keeps its team from rotating.
Fossil Museum: An elongated neck characterized history's largest turtle.

Name: Tophis
Description: Tophis has Solo Power, which sharply raises its attack when fighting without allies. It can also learn an attack that can cause an instant KO, although the chance is low.
Fossil Museum: An enormous snake over 3 feet thick and weighing a ton.

Name: Coelanth
Description: Coelanth's bag of tricks includes Super Enflame, a confuse skill, and a skill that can inflict several random conditions at once.
Fossil Museum: Thought to be extinct until live specimens were discovered.

Name: Dunkle
Description: Dunkle learns Dunkle Down, a skill that can instantly KO a target. It's worth a try in dire situations.
Fossil Museum: A giant fish, of which only the skull fossil has been found.

Name: Parapu
Description: Parapu is good at using confuse and poison skills. It enters battle with Harden already applied, which makes it good to go no matter when the team attacks.
Fossil Museum: Known for having the largest shell among the ammonites.

Name: Desmo
Description: Desmo goes into battle with Payback already applied and can retaliate even if the enemy attacks first.
Fossil Museum: A common ammonite that once lived throughout the world.

Name: Gaudry
Description: A Neutral-type vivosaur that learns scare skills, Gaudry enters battle with Harden already applied.
Fossil Museum: The fossils of this ammonite are often found in Japan.

Name: Radox
Description: Radox grows to support the team with an LP-healing skill and high speed. It enters battle with Payback applied so it can retaliate right away.
Fossil Museum: A common relative of trilobites from the Cambrian period.

Name: Terata
Description: Terata is the rare vivosaur that enters battle with Quicken applied. As it grows, it will provide team members with strong support effects across the board.
Fossil Museum: A relative of trilobites, it had a distinctively thorny body.

Name: Dikelo
Description: Dikelo can learn a skill that restores LP and lifts status conditions from all allies. It also enters battle with Quicken already applied.
Fossil Museum: A large trilobite first discovered in Morocco.

Name: Anomalo
Description: Anomalo learns a skill that heals LP and lifts status conditions from all team members. It also enters battle with Quicken already active.
Fossil Museum: The dominant marine predator of the Cambrian period.

Name: Tonzilla
Description: Tonzilla enters battle with Super Enflame already applied. Its Link ability also activates with nearly all allied attacks.
Fossil Museum: The Bonehemoth's tonsil, which uses its body like a club.

Name: B-Rex
Description: A boneysaur that learns skills like those of T-Rex. Being a skeleton, its LP is low.
Fossil Museum: The king of all boneysaurs!

Name: B-Brachio
Description: A boneysaur that learns skills like those of Brachio. Even though its LP is low, it has no elemental weakness.
Fossil Museum: A boneysaur that crushes foes.

Name: B-Lambeo
Description: A boneysaur that learns skills like those of Lambeo. Because it can learn a skill that restores team LP, it should be placed in the SZ position.
Fossil Museum: Often used by BB Brigade goons.

Name: B-Ptera
Description: A boneysaur that learns skills like those of Ptera. It can support the team with rotation and scare skills.
Fossil Museum: Despite its solid-bone body, it can somehow fly.

Name: B-Plesio
Description: A boneysaur that learns skills like those of Plesio. Exploit its strong support effects and poison skills to punish enemies.
Fossil Museum: A boneysaur of uncontested beauty exclusive to Cole.

Name: B-Tricera
Description: A boneysaur that learns skills like those of Proto. Bone Transform lets it change into another boneysaur.
Fossil Museum: An immeasurably destructive boneysaur exclusive to Lester.

Name: B-Jara
Description: A boneysaur that learns skills like those of Jara. Its support effects can sharply raise both Accuracy and Speed.
Fossil Museum: An elegant aerial-battling boneysaur exclusive to Lola.

Name: Z-Rex
Description: A zombiesaur with the Resurrect ability, Z-Rex can come back even if its LP drops to zero.
Fossil Museum: Evil flesh cloaks its foul bones.

Name: Z-Tricera
Description: Team Z-Tricera with other zombiesaurs to unlock a team skill that poisons the entire enemy team.
Fossil Museum: A powerful zombiesaur with horns that can tear through anything.

Name: Z-Ptera
Description: A zombiesaur with weak Attack and Defense stats that are compensated by powerful support effects. Keep it in the SZ at all costs.
Fossil Museum: A cruel zombiesaur that seeks to stab with its beak.

Name: Z-Elasmo
Description: A Mid-Range zombiesaur, Z-Elasmo's support effects progressively slash enemy stats as it ranks up.
Fossil Museum: A zombiesaur resurrected by Zongazonga's dark powers.

Name: Zongazonga
Description: Zongazonga is the most powerful zombiesaur, but its support effects sharply reduce all stats of allies. All skills also require vast amounts of FP.
Fossil Museum: An evil wizard that transformed itself with sorcery.

Name: Salada
Description: A boneysaur with a high Attack stat. While Salada's support effects boost the Attack and Speed of allies, they lower the other stats.
Fossil Museum: Ryne's specially created vivosaur has much in common with a freshly made salad.

Name: T-Rex Lord
Description: T-Rex Lord has the highest Attack power among super evolvers. Although its skills are powerful, their high FP costs make them tough to use.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a T-Rex. The body patterns are unique to each individual.

Name: Giga Allo
Description: Giga Allo has a very strong Attack rating, but its support effects lower several stats of AZ allies.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Allo. With its sharper fangs and claws, it is prone to violent behavior.

Name: Giga Spinax
Description: A Close-Range fighter with low Speed and high Attack, Giga Spinax has trouble avoiding incoming fire.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Spinax. Attacks bounce off the rock-hard hide of its back.

Name: V-Ripper
Description: Use V-Ripper's high Speed to grab the first attack, then support an ally with its Enflame skill.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a V-Raptor. It can attack while running at speeds exceeding 90 mph.

Name: Despino
Description: A Water-type super evolver, Despino learns poison skills as it ranks up.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Spino. It possesses overwhelming speed and melee skills.

Name: O-Raptor Fiend
Description: O-Raptor Fiend is a super evolver that excels at stealing FP from the enemy. Use it to build FP for powerful attacks.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an O-Raptor. The transformation makes it more viciousâ€”and less obedient.

Name: Ryden
Description: A super evolver suited to tormenting the enemy team, Ryden's skills include Power Scale for stealing FP and a rotation skill that can wreck enemy formations.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Brachio. It gained sufficient intelligence to converse with humans.

Name: Omias
Description: A Fire-type super evolver, Omias hinders the enemy with a scare-inducing skill and FP-stealing Power Scale.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Amargo. Its diminished size lets it strike with great speed and power.

Name: Barbaros
Description: A super evolver with an outstanding Defense rating, Barbaros can use confuse-inducing skills to further reduce the odds of being attacked.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Stego. Poor at running, it rolls into a ball to move more quickly.

Name: Dydomio
Description: A durable super evolver, Dydomio boasts a naturally high Defense rating. When augmented with the Super Harden skill, it becomes virtually indestructible.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Yango. The plates on its back can articulate to repel attacks.

Name: Galgaron
Description: Galgaron is a super evolver skilled in inflicting conditions on targets. As it grows, its support effect progressively boosts the Defense of allies in the AZ.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Ankylo. It is so heavy that it can't right itself once flipped onto its back.

Name: Zanth
Description: A super evolver that learns sleep and excite skills. When fully grown, Zanth's support effects can lower the Attack and Accuracy of AZ enemies by half.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Pelto. Its body can withstand extreme temperatures over 1800 degrees.

Name: Hibigon
Description: A powerful super evolver. As it grows, Hibigon's support effects increasingly boost Attack and Accuracy ratings.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Igua. Although shrunken in size, it can use powerful attacks.

Name: Papygon
Description: Papygon is a super evolver that can learn a strong confuse-inducing skill. Once it learns Sacrifice, it can heal allies in a pinch.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Anato. It has been known to sting like a bee and dance like a butterfly.

Name: Heracles
Description: Heracles is a super evolver whose high Attack at low ranks makes it a trusty choice. Its low Speed, however, is somewhat distressing.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Tricera. It takes pride in its horn, which it hones daily on trees.

Name: Buldor
Description: As it grows, Buldor's support effects progressively boost the Accuracy of allies. However, they also equally slash their Speed.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Pachrino. Distinguished by its large horns used for ramming.

Name: Dimorph Ace
Description: Dimorph Ace is a super evolver adept at the use of enrage skills. Its support effects can sharply lower all enemy stats.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Dimorph. Highly adept at gliding, it can even manage a hover.

Name: Momo
Description: When fully raised, Momo's support effects can slash the stats of AZ enemies in half. Just keep an eye on this super evolver's low LP.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Futabi. It's a fine swimmer, despite its small size.

Name: Kaishin
Description: A Mid-Range super evolver that learns enrage skills, Kaishin can also learn Law of the Jungle.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Elasmo. It hunts by swirling ocean currents into whirlpools.

Name: Marple
Description: Marple's support effects can strongly enhance the stats of allies in the AZ. Just keep an eye on its low LP.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Plesio. The floral patterns on its body bloom as it grows.

Name: Teffla
Description: Despite its appearance, Teffla can use Law of the Jungle. Its Teffla Dive is not only vicious, it can also excite the target.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver created by using a gold fossil on an Aeros. It scatters fine scales from its butterfly wings.

Name: Mapo King
Description: Mapo King can learn the devastating Royal Splash skill, but if it's in the SZ, it severely diminishes the stats of AZ allies.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Mapo. Its breath attacks grow mightier from the transformation.

Name: Giga Raja
Description: A super evolver with a naturally high Attack rating, Giga Raja can make its already hard-hitting attacks catastrophic using Charge.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Raja. Its well-developed arms can deliver mighty blows.

Name: Equinas
Description: Equinas is a super evolver possessing top-class Speed. It can also learn a skill that restores the LP of allies in return for its own LP.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Toba. Affectionate, it has been known to snuggle when content.

Name: Shenliu
Description: Shenliu has the highest LP among super evolvers. Use its scare skill to restrict the enemy's options.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Argento. Weighing 200 tons, it sets off tremors with every step.

Name: Bulgon
Description: Although very vulnerable to attack, Bulgon's fully raised support effects can devastate enemy stats.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Tsintao. Despite its tiny size, it bravely challenges much larger foes.

Name: Blitzigon
Description: Blitzigon is a super evolver with an outstanding Accuracy-boosting support effect. It also grows quickly, making it easy to use.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Chasmo. Once it starts running, it will not stop until it hits its foe.

Name: Nycto Ace
Description: As a Long-Range attacker, Nycto Ace should manipulate the enemy's formation with its rotation skill, then use its LP-stealing attack from the SZ.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Nycto. It can leap from great heights and ride winds to cross seas.

Name: Lugmos
Description: Lugmos is a Mid-Range super evolver that can learn Charge. Its Defense, however, leaves something to be desired.
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on a Dimetro. It gained extra fins that allowed it to swim freely.

Name: Geneos
Description: Geneos is a super evolver that can learn a rare skill that inflicts damage, poisons a target, and rotates the enemy team. Talk about a triple threat!
Fossil Museum: A super evolver made by using a gold fossil on an Edapho. It can change its body colors to blend in with its surroundings.

Name: Teratus
Description: Teratusâ€™ great stats and powerful attacks come complete with high success rate excite skills.
Fossil Museum: An extremely malicious killer, it was an apex predator due to its large size and impressive jaws, sporting some of the largest teeth ever recorded from tyrannosaur.

Name: Rugo
Description: Intimidating Combo is a powerful, reliable method for scaring the enemy
Fossil Museum: Rugops used the large amount of blood vessels running across its face to scare away other scavengers competing for food.

Name: Zhuca
Description: Zhucaâ€™s support effects harm its teamâ€™s defenses. Keep it in the AZ
Fossil Museum: Without a doubt one of the largest tyrannosaurs ever discovered, with distinctive deadly teeth.

Name: Siat
Description: Siat relies on the pure power of its stats. Use Harden to keep him in the fight.
Fossil Museum: A lean but massive dinosaur which was named after beasts from Native American mythology. Itâ€™s thought to have enlarged claws on its fingers.

Name: Dynamo
Description: Dynamo can inflict the rare sleep status quite well with Neon Twist.
Fossil Museum: A relatively large tyrannosaur. Specimens have been found close to Deinosuchus fossils, suggesting the two dominant carnivores had a rivalry.

Name: Ganax
Description: Frigid Jaws has a very reliable 100% excite rate. Ganax Moxie can also scare opponents
Fossil Museum: It was the largest and most ferocious predator of the North American region during the Jurrasic.

Name: Thanatos
Description: Packing expensive yet supremely deadly poison skills, its final skill has a 100% success rate!
Fossil Museum: The only known fossils are of its deadly lower jaws, with its skull estimated to be around 80 centimeters long.

Name: Stoko
Description: Stoko can transform into a powerful Teratus. Be careful it doesnâ€™t run out of LP too soon.
Fossil Museum: One of the very first tyrannosaurs, second only to guanlong. It was small but extremely fast for its size.

Name: Iloki
Description: Iloki can automatically recover LP. Take advantage of its dependable set of attacks.
Fossil Museum: It was classified as an Abelisaur, a group of dinosaurs which included species like Carnotaurus and Rajasaurus. Its name is made using Mapuche language.

Name: Bisti
Description: Bisti has a very amount of LP for a neutral type, as well as helpful support effects.
Fossil Museum: This large tyrannosaur had an impressive 64 teeth lining its jaws.

Name: Indo
Description: A well-rounded vivosaur, Indo is a great ally for rookie Fossil Fighters.
Fossil Museum: Only skull fragments have been found of this enigmatic dinosaur.

Name: Torvo
Description: Torvo focuses on attack. Use Incinerate to try and scare your enemies even more!
Fossil Museum: Suspected to be one of the largest theropods of the Jurassic.

Name: Cruxo
Description: Along with its bulk, Cruxo is able to inflict the enemy team in a wide variety of ways.
Fossil Museum: Its only fossils were discovered deep within a quarry and were initially mistaken for Megalosaurus. In 2010 it was given its new name, but still little is known.

Name: Conca
Description: Concaâ€™s different roaring attacks are good for inflicting the enemy with strong effects.
Fossil Museum: It had a large, curved sail running down its lower back. It was thought to have used this sail in order to identify other members of its species.

Name: Dubru
Description: Dubru has excellent support effects, making him useful in the SZ as well as the AZ.
Fossil Museum: Dubreullisaurus would travel along the coast, scavenging for prey.

Name: Drypto
Description: Use Agitating Breath to pelt your enemy and inflict them with a strong enraged status.
Fossil Museum: A relative of Tyrannosaurus with exceptionally powerful jaws, Dryptosaurus was a very fast hunter.

Name: Via
Description: A good vivosaur for dishing out cheap attacks, but its support effects are less than ideal.
Fossil Museum: There are not many distinguishing features from fossil remains, leads to believe that Viavenator was a transitional form of dinosaur.

Name: Megro
Description: Megroâ€™s most powerful skill is Lethal Haze, the most powerful poison skill there is.
Fossil Museum: When it was discovered, paleontologists initially believed it to be a giant Velociraptor.

Name: Jura
Description: With Fear Fire Jura can help its allies secure a KO, then step in again with Power Scale.
Fossil Museum: Fossil evidence of its eyes indicated that it most likely a nocturnal hunter. It was also thought to have no feathers but rather a scaly body.

Name: Psittaco
Description: Psittacoâ€™s incredible support effects rival Compsos. As an added bonus, it comes with Quicken.
Fossil Museum: A primitive kind of ceratopsian dinosaur with smaller, undeveloped horns,

Name: Achillo
Description: Achilloâ€™s excellent excite skills are made more relieable by its incredible accuracy.
Fossil Museum: One of the largest dromaeosaurids ever found, it is named for its strongly developed Achilles tendon. Its closest relative would have been the Utahraptor.

Name: D-Raptor
Description: A water type foil to U-Raptor, only now with a potent scare skill!
Fossil Museum: One of the largest dromaeosaurids to ever walk the earth, second only to Utahraptor. Early fossil records indicated the existence of feathers on its arms.

Name: B-Raptor
Description: B-Raptor can help your team with its support effects and inflict confusion with its attacks.
Fossil Museum: Like other similar raptor species, its thought to have had feathers covering its body.

Name: Bahlu
Description: Bahlu has access to multiple skills that can put enemies to sleep, leaving them unable to attack.
Fossil Museum: It had short but robust bones, along with  2 sickle claws on each of its feet. It was named after a dragon from Romanian folklore.

Name: A-Raptor
Description: Enraged and Excite skills as well as good support effects, A-Raptor is a crafty yet complete package.
Fossil Museum: Known for its incredibly small forearms, it is thought to have hunted smaller animals.

Name: Sino
Description: Sino has FP Plus as well as Sunset Soother. Use it to heal your allies.
Fossil Museum: It shares many traits with, and is often confused for, Dilophosaurus.

Name: Ichthyo
Description: Great stats as well as an ability to heal LP, Ichthyo is a very potent force.
Fossil Museum: Was thought to have had a large wedge in the middle of its sail.

Name: Oxala
Description: Like other similar vivosaurs, Oxala can passively heal its own LP every turn.
Fossil Museum: Named after an African god, the only fossil evidence of the species is part of its snout. Itâ€™s the second largest spinosaurid behind Spinosaurus.

Name: Auca
Description: Auca doesnâ€™t have access to a team skill. It needs to be used carefully.
Fossil Museum: Almost an entire skeletal structure, has been found, with only the end of its tail being missing. It would fight others of its species in headbutting contents.

Name: Majunga
Description: Majungaâ€™s Hypno Horn confuses the enemy, while Power Scale steals their FP.
Fossil Museum: It had a singular spike on the top of its head. Its skull, however, was rounded and formed a dome-like surface which was used for fighting.

Name: Galli
Description: Galliâ€™s support effects are certainly potent. Use them to cripple the enemy AZ.
Fossil Museum: Its most notable trait was its great speed. Since it could outrun predators, it did not need to worry about its slender body being incapable of making tight turns.

Name: Pelaca
Description: When teamed up with Galli, Peleca can create devastatingly strong supoprt effects.
Fossil Museum: Like a pelican, Pelecanimimus would wade into water in search of prey. Limestone imprints reveal a pouch on its lower jaw which was used to store food.

Name: Nothro
Description: Nothro can barely hit its target, but when it does itâ€™s always a decisive blow.
Fossil Museum: Itâ€™s theorized it used its long claws to grip the branches of trees, just like a sloth.

Name: Girafi
Description: Like Cryoâ€™s Cold Shout, Girafi Impring can excite the opponent easily.
Fossil Museum: Because of the inconsistency of the fossils which have been found, it is still undetermined whether its nasal cavities were located on top of its head.

Name: Vulca
Description: Vulca has useful support effects, as well as a skill that can scare the enemy.
Fossil Museum: It was the first discovered between two beds of lava, which earned it the named â€œVolcano Tooth.â€ It is thought to have lived in arid environments.

Name: Cetio
Description: With Power Scale behind Cetioâ€™s bulky stats, you can make sure your team is never too low on LP
Fossil Museum: The first sauropod species ever recorded. At the time of its discovery, it was mistaken for a large marine reptile.

Name: Amphas
Description: Amphas has the highest LP stat of any vivosaur, as well as good support effects to boost its allies defenses.
Fossil Museum: It was once thought to be the largest dinosaur ever to exist. However, this cannot be proven as the original fossils are now lost forever.

Name: Baros
Description: Baros has high defense and LP, letting him give back a lot of damage with Auto Counter.
Fossil Museum: Despite its name meaning â€œheavy lizardâ€ it was very light for its massive size. Like its relative, Diplodocus, It had a long, slender neck and a whip like tail.

Name: Qijian
Description: A titanic vivosaur with FP Plus, Qijian is certainly a unique find.
Fossil Museum: It is only known from one juvenile specimen. However, its fossil showed it to already be 15 meters in length, so adults would have managed to be larger still.

Name: Qiaow
Description: Qioawâ€™s scare skills are frighteningly similar to those of the one and only T-Rex
Fossil Museum: This Chinese sauropod was at first thought to be a Brachiosaurus. After further research, it was renamed after dragons from the local culture.

Name: Wuerho
Description: Wuerho, like U-Raptor and Titoa, has access to the  ultimate poison skill.
Fossil Museum: A dinosaur shrouded in mystery, it was one of the last stegosaurs to exist. Rectangular plates line its back.

Name: Alcova
Description: Alcovaâ€™s inexpensive attacks make him a good early addition to any team.
Fossil Museum: Most reconstructions of this dinosaur are based off of Kentrosaurus.

Name: Linga
Description: Bullet Spines doesnâ€™t deal damage, but has a 100% enraged chance
Fossil Museum: The special arrangement of pointed spikes running down its tail were used for display and defense against predators.

Name: Hespero
Description: Hesperoâ€™s skills are all able to inflict status effects, but they arenâ€™t very powerful.
Fossil Museum: Its plates were notable for being wider than they were tall.

Name: Gaia
Description: Gaia is a very dependable stegosaur thanks to its neutral typing.
Fossil Museum: It had the longest neck and limbs for any stegosaur, making it very similar to certain sauropods.

Name: Euplo
Description: Along with boosting the AZs defense, Euplo can both confuse and scare enemies.
Fossil Museum: Its fossils are so well preserved because of how hard its armor was. It was able to use its flexible tail to swing at potential predators like a hammer.

Name: Antarcto
Description: Antarcto has some of the best support effects available for a vivosaur of its type.
Fossil Museum: A rare species of nodosaur residing in Antarctica, it lacked a club on its tail.

Name: Tarca
Description: Rather than boosting your own teams defense, Tarca focuses on hindering the opponents.
Fossil Museum: It is one of the largest ankylosaurs ever discovered, bigger than the more famous Ankylosaurus. Its powerful teeth and jaw were used to grind up plants.

Name: Scelido
Description: Scelido gives a useful boost to all an AZ vivosaurâ€™s stats, with a significant buff to defense.
Fossil Museum: Along with Megalosaurus, Scelidosaurus is one of the only two dinosaurs with fossils found in Ireland.

Name: Aleto
Description: Aletoâ€™s support effects give a quite helpful increase to both attack and defense.
Fossil Museum: The species was given its name for the vast distances their fossil remains have traveled, mainly due to continental drifting over millions of years.

Name: Mutabura
Description: Mutaburaâ€™s final skill is a bit more expensive than other hadrosaurs, but Quick Jab is very accessible in return.
Fossil Museum: One of the best-known dinosaurs from Australia, it had special teeth that would be used to slice through plants while it was eating.

Name: Fukui
Description: Fukuiâ€™s attacks are weak but inexpensive. Its stats also arenâ€™t very impressive.
Fossil Museum: Named after is discovery site, Fukuisaurus was much smaller than later hadrosaurs.

Name: Krito
Description: Kritoâ€™s support effects are somewhat better than other similar vivosaurs.
Fossil Museum: Its skull has distinctly separated cheek bones, which enabled it to eat a wide variety of plants.

Name: Shantu
Description: For a cheap way to counter attacksk, use Shantuâ€™s signature Sumo Stance skill.
Fossil Museum: Although a complete skeleton has never been found, multiple specimens can be combined to form a full body measuring upwards of 50 feet long.

Name: Corytho
Description: Just like Lambeo, Corytho has impressive bulk and access to a healing skill.
Fossil Museum: A well known hadrosaur which used its crest to make trumpet calls. Many have been discovered in the same locations, so they likely  herded in groups.

Name: Kamuie
Description: A strong neutral vivosaur with many healing skills. It also has the Auto LP Recovery ability.
Fossil Museum: Although some parts of the skull are missing, Kamuysaurus is known for being one of the best preserved dinosaur skeletons ever found in Japan.

Name: Magni
Description: Keep Magni in the SZ! Its Link ability will trigger Frost Punch, which excites anything it hits.
Fossil Museum: An agile swimmer due to its large limbs and buoyancy, similar to modern day elepahants.

Name: Carono
Description: Caronoâ€™s attacks are incredibly powerful while not costing too much FP.
Fossil Museum: Charonosaurus was named after Charen, the ferryman of the underworld, a Greek myth.

Name: Stegas
Description: Stegas has Unknown Fate, which allows it to transform into literally any vivosaur!
Fossil Museum: A very small pachycephalosaur, it once was thought to use its skull for headbutting. Now, itâ€™s believed to have used it to ram predators from the side.

Name: Draco
Description: Toxic Head is extremely deadly, but youâ€™ll have to get the most out of it before Draco gets easily taken out.
Fossil Museum: Very little evidence has been found of this dinosaur. It has been hypothesized that the species is a juvenile Pachycephalosaurus.

Name: Regali
Description: Regali Combo is very dependable for disrupting enemy formation.
Fossil Museum: The horns and neck frills were particularly used for display instead of defense.

Name: Anchi
Description: Anchiâ€™s cheap attacks along with Power Scale make him good for managing FP easily.
Fossil Museum: Anchiceratops had a long neck and short tail. It was named by Barnum Brown, the same paleontologist who discovered Tyrannosaurus.

Name: Utops
Description: Utops is a good healer. Save up FP to use his recovery skills if your team is in a bind.
Fossil Museum: With horns that were not especially large, Utahceratops may have relied on their distinctive colors on their frills in order to identify others of their kind.

Name: Diablos
Description: An impressive support vivosaur, Diablos Plague is well worth the FP needed.
Fossil Museum: One of the strangest of all ceratopsian dinosaurs, Diabloceratops, serves as a sort of â€œmissing linkâ€ in their evolutionary progression.

Name: Kosma
Description: One of the strongest vivosaurs in terms of the unique variety of things it can do.
Fossil Museum: The eight horns on the top of its head curve downward unlike any other species, while its central nasal horn is curved inward to form an axe-like blade.

Name: Meduso
Description: Just like Medusa, itâ€™s strongest skill has a chance to scare the opponent.
Fossil Museum: This ceratopsian dinosaur gained its name from the snake-like horns which extended from the side of its frill, like the ancient Greek creature Medusa.

Name: Tavis
Description: A pterosaur that isnâ€™t quite a pterosaur, Tavis is still just as strong.
Fossil Museum: With a wingspan over 7 feet, it was the largest bird species to ever live. The only bird with a larger wingspan is Pelagornis, but it had a much slenderer body.

Name: Tupa
Description: A unique trait to Tupa, it can steal FP from the other team using Steam Trick.
Fossil Museum: It was a large pterosaur which was, upon its discovery, mistaken for the skull of a Tapejara. It would hunt for fish in rivers and lakes.

Name: Tropeo
Description: Use Boost Beam to excite the enemy, then finish them off with Spite Blast.
Fossil Museum: Large crests on its jaws helped align its flight while searching lakes for fish.

Name: Zejian
Description: With good LP for a pterosaur, Zejian suffers from less than ideal support effects.
Fossil Museum: Often considered to be a smaller relative of the more famous Quetzalcoatlus.

Name: Tylo
Description: Its attacks are expensive, but its great stats and Poisonous Jaws make up for it easily.
Fossil Museum: Its snout would become damaged from frequent territorial sparring.

Name: Termino
Description: Termino can inflict sleep with 100% efficiency, which makes it a big target.
Fossil Museum: Possibly one of the last elasmsaurids to exist. It had a noticeably short snout with long teeth, and was also quite possibly nocturnal.

Name: Aristo
Description: Aristoâ€™s support effects significantly hinder the enemyâ€™s attack and evasion.
Fossil Museum: Rather than hunting for fish, it was proven to be a special type of filter feeder.

Name: Libo
Description: A neutral type vivosaur packed with versatility, Libo is a distinct edition to any team.
Fossil Museum: A fierce underwater predator, it had a neck just about half of its entire body.

Name: Megadon
Description: Having stats like those, thereâ€™s no contest that Megadon is the king of the ocean.
Fossil Museum: Normally called just Megalodon, the largest teeth discovered were 20cm long. On average, they were over 10 meters longer than a Great White Shark.

Name: Uinta
Description: Perplexia Beam can be used every turn for a good shot at inflicting confusion.
Fossil Museum: It is most comparable to a rhinoceros with several smaller horns on top of its head. Males would have large canine teeth used for fighting.

Name: Embolo
Description: Eremo can boost defense in many ways, with his support effects as well as with Super Harden.
Fossil Museum: Despite what we know of its incredible size, a full skelton has never been found. The single lightweight plate which rose from its snout was used for display.

Name: Nosmu
Description: An air element rival to Hoplo and Smilo, take advantage of his incredibly cheap attacks.
Fossil Museum: A type of saber-toothed cat that rivaled Smilodon in size and muscle. It could wrestle prey into submission with incredible speed and force.

Name: Gorgops
Description: Gorgops can link up with ally attacks as well as help out those allies with Syper Enflame.
Fossil Museum: Unlike other therapsids from its time, Gorgonops was warm blooded, suggesting that it was actually covered in a layer of fur.

Name: Rodho
Description: If you can steal FP from the enemy with Rodho Backflip, you can always have the upper hand.
Fossil Museum: A primitive and early species of whale which also had limbs with webbed feet. It is debated whether it had ears, as fossil records have not revealed any imprints.

Name: Deino
Description: A neutral type foil to Mammoth, Deinoâ€™s Super Enflame is great for powering up allies.
Fossil Museum: Unlike most other elephants of its era, it had two short tusks that pointed downward. Its skull was also unique for its mostly flat top.

Name: Kenken
Description: Just like Tryma, Kenken can link up with its teammates while itâ€™s in the SZ.
Fossil Museum: One of the largest â€œterror birds,â€ it stood half a meter above the average human.

Name: Eremo
Description: Eremoâ€™s not a fighter, reflected in itâ€™s abysmal attack. Instead, it lulls your opponents to sleep.
Fossil Museum: Standing at 4 meters tall, it rivaled Megatherium in size. It is notable for having fossils found in both North and South America.

Name: Syndyo
Description: A great support vivosaur with an attack that can hit bothe the AZ and SZ.
Fossil Museum: It had a pair of crescent shaped horns that raised up from the back of its skull. Itâ€™s likely that they were covered by skin, mainly being used for display.

Name: Titoa
Description: Acid Bomb deals 0 damage, but has a good rate of success for inflicting the ultimate poison.
Fossil Museum: The largest snake species ever to exist. It had a reputation species ever to exist. It had a reputation for hunting very large prey, including crocodiles, lungfish, and large turtles.

Name: Rhizo
Description: Rhizoâ€™s attacks are quite cheap. Support your team by keeping him in the SZ and using Super Quicken.
Fossil Museum: Comes from a family of lobe-finned fish usually found in Australian deposits. Rhizodus is special, though, for its discovery in Ireland and large size.

Name: Xipha
Description: Xipha Lockjaw is a major threat to any vivosaur it comes into contact with. Unfortunately, it has no support effects.
Fossil Museum: An an incredibly large prehistoric fish, it could easily swallow a human in one half bite.

Name: Camero
Description: Its defense is impressive for a long range vivosaur.  You can safely keep it in the SZ.
Fossil Museum: Modern estimates show that its shell was about 6 meters long, although earlier it was thought to have been even larger.

Name: Terella
Description: Terellaâ€™s support effects are intense! Mind the fact that it wonâ€™t last long in a battle.
Fossil Museum: Its huge eyes and narrow body were specially designed to help it swim in open water. It had a total of 9-10 thorax segments along its body.

Name: Amplecto
Description: Amplecto has an attack that can hit both the AZ and SZ, good for a long ranged vivosaur.
Fossil Museum: It had large, claw-like appendages on the front of its body. Uniquely, remains have been found both in China and Canada.

Name: Duchus
Description: Duchus has great attack but its skills are on the more expensive side.
Fossil Museum: Deinosuchus, on average, was a whole 2 meters longer than modern alligators.

Name: Sarco
Description: A leaner, water type alternative to Duchus, Sarco can do great damage while in the AZ.
Fossil Museum: Sarcosuchus was not just bigger than todayâ€™s crocodiles it was also a lot older.â€­ â€¬Most crocodiles have an average lifespan in the wild of around twenty-five years.

Name: Livytan
Description: This titanic beast needs a lot of FP to use, but all its attacks are utterly devastating.
Fossil Museum: Not dissimilar to the modern-day sperm whale, it had the largest teeth used for consumption of any animal.

Name: Basilo
Description: An absolute tank with loads of LP, Basiloâ€™s attacks are very expensive and very powerful.
Fossil Museum: Unlike present-day whales, its front fins had an elbow joint.

Name: Brygmo
Description: The smallest of the whale vivosaurs, Brygmo still has expensive yet strong attacks.
Fossil Museum: A big evolutionary step for early whales, it was related to earlier primative Eocene animals like Pakicetus and Rodhocetus.

Name: Eurypto
Description: Eurypto X only costs 10 FP, yet it has a chance to scare opponents.
Fossil Museum: Although it shares a number of features with modern-day arachnids, it is distinct enough to be considered a different evolutionary branch.

Name: Moshop
Description: Moshops is best kept in the AZ where it can easily hit all enemy vivosaurs at once.
Fossil Museum: One of the biggest herbivores of its time, it would regularly contest its strength with other members of its species. Its skull was roughly 10 centimeters thick.

Name: Anura
Description: Anuraâ€™s attacks are incredibly cheap. Donâ€™t let its cuteness fool you!
Fossil Museum: It has small sharp teeth, and a head wider than it was long. The positioning of its eyes allowed for binocular vision, and itâ€™s highly likely that it was nocturnal.

Name: Luru
Description: Luru has super enflame as well as great attack boosting support effects.
Fossil Museum: A similar ancestor of the modern-day Red Panda. Despite it being somewhat larger its bite was weaker, so it would defend itself using its claws.

Name: Kurina
Description: A living fossil, almost all of Kurinaâ€™s skills attack enemies in both the AZ and SZ.
Fossil Museum: A living fossil as well as a unique type of shark, it has a special type of snout used for echolocation. Its jaws are also able to extend and retract to catch prey.
